DataElement.preferredName: Child Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia Therapeutic Procedure Unplanned Hospitalization Yes No Unknown Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not a child being treated for Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia has had any unplanned hospitalizations.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Child Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia Therapeutic Procedure Unplanned Hospitalization
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An age group comprised of individuals who are not yet an adult. The specific cut-off age will vary by purpose._Leukemia with an acute onset, characterized by the presence of lymphoblasts in the bone marrow and the peripheral blood. It includes the acute B lymphoblastic leukemia and acute T lymphoblastic leukemia._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._Not expected or scheduled._The condition of being treated as a patient in a hospital.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A son or daughter of any age, including biological offspring and sometimes including unborn children, adopted children, stepchildren, foster children and children born outside of marriage; person under an age specified by law.

Concepts.definition: An age group comprised of individuals who are not yet an adult. The specific cut-off age will vary by purpose.

Property.preferredName: Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia Therapeutic Procedure Unplanned Hospitalization
Property.preferredDefinition: Leukemia with an acute onset, characterized by the presence of lymphoblasts in the bone marrow and the peripheral blood. It includes the acute B lymphoblastic leukemia and acute T lymphoblastic leukemia.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:Not expected or scheduled.:The condition of being treated as a patient in a hospital.

Concepts.definition: Leukemia with an acute onset, characterized by the presence of lymphoblasts in the bone marrow and the peripheral blood. It includes the acute B lymphoblastic leukemia and acute T lymphoblastic leukemia.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
The condition of being treated as a patient in a hospital.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.
